wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Sinesys legal management system. Explain its purpose as a comprehensive platform for law firms to manage legal processes, client relationships, and judicial data capture from PJE/TRT systems. Document the architecture with its Next.js frontend, backend services, and Supabase database. Describe the relationship between core components like the dashboard, data capture system, contract management, and hearing scheduling. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'acervo', 'audiencias', and 'expedientes'. Provide practical examples demonstrating common use cases like capturing process data from PJE-TRT or managing client contracts. Document the implementation details including the Domain-Driven Design approach, three-tier architecture, and real-time collaboration features.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layered Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Sinesys layered architecture. Describe the four-layer structure consisting of Presentation, Application, Domain, and Infrastructure layers. Detail the responsibilities of each layer: Presentation layer handling UI components in app/(dashboard)/, Application layer managing business services in backend/services/, Domain layer containing pure business logic in types/domain/, and Infrastructure layer handling data persistence in backend/persistence/. Document the strict dependency rules between layers (dependencies flow downward only) and how this enables maintainability and testability. Explain how React Server Components in the Presentation layer interact with backend services through API routes, and how the Domain layer remains independent of infrastructure concerns. Include examples from the codebase showing this separation, such as how the acervo service uses the domain entities without knowing the database implementation. Address how this architecture supports scalability and team organization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for authentication endpoints in the Sinesys system. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication flows for login, signup, password reset, and 2FAuth integration. Detail the JWT-based authentication using Supabase Auth, including token generation, validation, and refresh mechanisms. Document endpoints like /api/auth/login, /api/auth/signup, /api/auth/me, and /api/auth/confirm. For each endpoint, specify parameters, return values, error codes (401, 403, 429), and usage examples. Include implementation details about session management, cookie-based authentication, and CSRF protection. Provide practical examples of how frontend components interact with these endpoints, such as the LoginForm component calling the login API. Address security considerations including rate limiting, brute force protection, and JWT expiration policies. Document the integration with 2FAuth for two-factor authentication and how it enhances security.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Dashboard Module of the Sinesys application. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the dashboard grid system, widget personalization, and data visualization components. Document the architecture of the drag-and-drop dashboard layout, including the EnhancedDashboardGrid and SortableDashboard components. Explain how dashboard widgets (obrigacoes-widget, tarefas-widget, links-widget, etc.) retrieve and display data from various modules like processes, hearings, and financial obligations. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as the implementation of the dashboard-content.tsx component and the dashboard-store.ts state management. Address the backend services in backend/dashboard/ that provide metric data, and document the Supabase schema for dashboard persistence. Cover common issues like widget loading states and performance optimization for large datasets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Login Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the login process in Sinesys. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the authentication flow using Supabase Auth with email/password credentials. Document the frontend components including the login form, error handling, and success redirection. Explain the backend authentication API endpoints and how they integrate with Supabase's authentication system. Include details about JWT token generation, session management, and secure cookie handling. Provide concrete examples from the actual codebase showing the login form implementation and API integration. Explain the relationship between the frontend login page and backend authentication services. Address common issues such as incorrect credentials, network errors, and account lockout policies, along with their solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Schema Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive schema overview documentation for the Sinesys database. Describe the high-level organization of the database schema with its 36 schema files that define tables, views, enums, and functions. Document the core domain entities including Acervo (legal processes), Clientes (clients), Contratos (contracts), Audiencias (hearings), Usuarios (users), Partes (parties), Representantes (representatives), and Documentos (documents). Explain the purpose and scope of each major schema component and how they relate to business domains. Include a system context diagram showing the major schema groupings and their relationships. Document the use of PostgreSQL features like enums, views, and row-level security policies. Provide an overview of the data lifecycle from capture to archival, and explain how the schema supports the application's legal management workflows. Address cross-cutting concerns like data privacy, audit logging through logs_alteracao table, and security enforcement via RLS policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: PJE-TRT Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the PJE-TRT integration component of the Sinesys data capture system. Explain its purpose in automating data extraction from the PJE-TRT judicial system, including the architecture of the integration layer and its relationship to other components. Document the implementation details of the trt-auth.service for authentication, timeline-capture.service for data extraction, and trt-capture.service for orchestrating the capture process. Include configuration options for tribunal-specific settings, usage patterns for initiating captures, and practical examples demonstrating the end-to-end process from authentication to data persistence. Document the public interfaces, parameters, and return values for the API endpoints that facilitate this integration. Address common issues such as authentication failures, rate limiting by the PJE system, and handling of temporary service outages, providing solutions and workarounds. Include diagrams illustrating the data flow from the PJE-TRT system through the capture services to the database.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Editor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the document editor in Sinesys. Explain the implementation of the Plate editor framework with rich text editing capabilities, including support for headings, lists, code blocks, tables, and embedded media. Document the extension system that enables features like AI-powered content generation, equation editing, and document collaboration. Describe the toolbar components and their functionality, including formatting options, insert menus, and export capabilities. Include implementation details about the editor's integration with React and Next.js, including server-side rendering considerations and client-side hydration. Provide practical examples of creating different document types such as legal briefs, contracts, and internal memos. Address common issues such as formatting inconsistencies across browsers and solutions for handling large documents with performance optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Library (shadcn/ui)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the shadcn/ui-based UI library in Sinesys. Describe the component library architecture and its integration with Tailwind CSS for styling. Document each component category (accordion, alert, avatar, badge, button, card, checkbox, combobox, dialog, dropdown, form, input, popover, select, table, tabs, toast, etc.), including their visual appearance, behavior, and user interaction patterns. For each component, document props/attributes, events, slots, and customization options with examples from actual implementation. Include usage examples with code snippets showing how components are used in the application, such as the dashboard widgets or hearing calendar. Provide guidelines for responsive design and accessibility compliance following WCAG standards. Document component states, animations, and transitions implemented with Framer Motion. Include style customization options and theming support through CSS variables. Address cross-browser compatibility issues and performance optimization techniques like code splitting and lazy loading. Explain how these components follow the design system principles outlined in the help section.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unit Tests
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the unit testing strategy in Sinesys. Thoroughly explain the implementation of unit tests using Jest for backend services and business logic components. Document testing patterns for service classes like AcordosCondenacoesService and AudienciasService, including mocking dependencies and testing edge cases. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase such as tests for agreement creation, hearing validation, and financial calculations. Explain the use of test doubles for database access, external APIs, and authentication services. Document the test setup, beforeEach/afterEach patterns, and assertion strategies used across the codebase. Address common issues in unit testing such as testing asynchronous operations, handling database transactions in tests, and ensuring test isolation. Provide guidance on writing effective unit tests that follow the project's patterns and conventions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Presentation Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Sinesys Presentation Layer. Describe how this layer implements the user interface using Next.js App Router with React Server Components. Detail the organization of UI components in the app/(dashboard)/ directory and reusable components in the components/ directory. Explain how React Server Components enable server-side rendering while maintaining interactivity through Client Components. Document the use of shadcn/ui and custom UI components for consistent design. Include examples from the codebase showing how dashboard pages like acordos-condenacoes and audiencias are structured with their respective components. Address how the Presentation Layer communicates with the Application Layer through API routes, and how data is passed from server components to client components. Cover the implementation of responsive design, accessibility features, and real-time collaboration using Yjs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Bounded Contexts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the Bounded Contexts implementation in Sinesys. Thoroughly explain how the system is divided into distinct bounded contexts for Acervo (legal processes), Audiencias (hearings), Financeiro (financial obligations), and Partes (parties/clients). Document the context map showing relationships between these bounded contexts, including upstream/downstream relationships and integration patterns. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how each bounded context maintains its own model and language, such as the Acervo context focusing on process tracking while the Financeiro context handles payment agreements. Explain the benefits of this separation in preventing model corruption and enabling independent evolution of different business domains. Address how context boundaries are enforced through API boundaries and dependency management, and discuss challenges in maintaining context consistency across bounded contexts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Primary Data Pathways
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the primary data pathways in Sinesys. Explain the complete flow of data from user interface interactions through API routes to business logic services and persistence layers. Document specific examples such as the process of retrieving legal processes (acervo), scheduling hearings (audiencias), and managing agreements (acordos-condenacoes). Detail the data transformation at each layer and how request parameters are validated and processed. Explain the role of React Server Components in pre-fetching data and how this affects the data flow. Provide code examples from the actual implementation showing the data flow between app/api/acervo/route.ts and the corresponding backend services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend-Backend Interactions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for frontend-backend interactions in Sinesys. wiki_catalogs.name: Capture Scheduling Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for capture scheduling endpoints in the Sinesys system. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods for the /api/captura/agendamentos endpoint. Detail the scheduling parameters including tribunal ID, frequency, execution time, and credential references. Document the response schema with schedule ID, next execution time, and status. Include implementation details about the agendamento-scheduler.service.ts that handles cron-based execution and the executar-agendamento.service.ts that processes scheduled captures. Provide practical examples of how the frontend capture interface creates, updates, and deletes capture schedules. Address common issues like overlapping schedules, timezone handling, and failed execution recovery. Document the distributed locking mechanism that prevents concurrent execution of the same schedule.

wiki_catalogs.name: Accounts Payable
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for accounts payable endpoints in the Sinesys system. Cover endpoints such as /api/financeiro/contas-pagar for CRUD operations, /api/financeiro/contas-pagar/recorrentes/gerar for generating recurring payments, and /api/financeiro/contas-pagar/exportar for data export. wiki_catalogs.name: Document CRUD Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for document CRUD endpoints in the Sinesys system. wiki_catalogs.name: Client Management API

wiki_catalogs.name: Clients

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Entity Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for core entity relationships in the Sinesys system. Explain the Acervo (legal processes) entity as the central hub connecting to multiple other entities. Document the relationship between Acervo and Clientes through the processo_cliente view, showing how client information is linked to processes. Detail the many-to-many relationship between Processos and Partes (parties) via the processo_partes junction table, including foreign key constraints and cascading behaviors. Explain the relationship between Acervo and Contratos through the contrato_processos table, illustrating how contracts are associated with specific processes. Document the connection between Acervo and Audiencias (hearings), showing how hearings are scheduled for specific processes. Describe the hierarchical structure of Representantes (representatives) with parent-child relationships through the representante_id_pai field. Include practical examples of queries that traverse these relationships, such as finding all parties involved in a specific process or identifying all contracts associated with a client's processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Legal Process Tables
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for legal process-related database tables in the Sinesys system. Detail the acervo table structure including fields like numero_processo (VARCHAR, primary key), tribunal (ENUM referencing tribunals table), grau (ENUM for first/second degree), classe_judicial (VARCHAR for legal classification), and responsavel_id (UUID foreign key to usuarios). Document the expedientes table with fields such as tipo_expediente_id (foreign key), data_criacao, data_baixa, and observacoes. For the audiencias table, explain data_audiencia (TIMESTAMP), sala_virtual (VARCHAR), url_virtual (TEXT), modalidade (ENUM for virtual/in-person), and endereco_presencial (JSONB for physical address). Include relationships between these tables, such as acervo having multiple audiencias and expedientes. Provide sample records illustrating typical data patterns. Document any triggers like automatic timestamp updates and constraints ensuring data integrity. Explain how these tables support the core legal process tracking functionality of the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Acervo Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Acervo data flow in Sinesys. Explain the complete journey of a request to retrieve legal processes from the user interface through the API layer to the business logic and persistence layers. Document how the request is handled in app/api/acervo/route.ts, passed to listar-acervo.service.ts for business logic processing, and finally executed in the persistence layer. Include a sequence diagram showing the interaction between these components, highlighting data transformation and validation steps. Detail how React Server Components in the dashboard pages pre-fetch acervo data and how pagination, filtering, and sorting are implemented across the stack. Provide code examples showing the data flow from the frontend page component through the API route to the database query execution, including error handling and response formatting.

wiki_catalogs.name: PJE-TRT Integration Errors
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for PJE-TRT integration error handling in Sinesys. Explain how errors are handled during automated data capture from PJE-TRT systems, including authentication failures, network timeouts, and HTML parsing errors. Document the retry mechanisms and credential rotation strategies implemented in the pje-expediente-documento.service.ts. Detail how capture errors are logged and tracked in the captura-log-persistence.service.ts with MongoDB integration. Explain the error recovery process and how users are notified of failed captures through the dashboard interface. Provide examples of common PJE-TRT error scenarios and their resolution paths. Include best practices for handling transient vs. permanent errors in the capture pipeline.

wiki_catalogs.name: Agreement-Installment Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the relationship between judgment agreements (acordos_condenacoes) and their installments (parcelas) in the Sinesys system. Detail the database schema with foreign key constraints from parcelas to acordos_condenacoes, including ON DELETE CASCADE behavior. Explain the data model where each agreement contains multiple installments with fields for value, due date, status, and payment date. Document the service layer implementation in acordo-condenacao-persistence.service.ts and parcela-persistence.service.ts that manages these relationships. Describe the business logic for installment creation, recalculation of distribution, and status updates. Include information about the UI representation in parcelas-table.tsx and how users interact with installment data. Provide examples of common operations such as creating installments for a new agreement, updating installment status upon payment, and querying all installments for a specific agreement.

wiki_catalogs.name: Process-Party Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the process-party relationships in the Sinesys system. Explain the processo_partes junction table as the central mechanism for connecting processes (acervo) with various types of parties (clientes, partes_contrarias, terceiros, representantes). Document the foreign key constraints that ensure referential integrity between processo_partes and both the acervo and parties tables. Detail the role field that specifies the capacity in which each party participates in the process (e.g., plaintiff, defendant, representative). Explain the cascading delete behavior that maintains data consistency when processes are removed. Describe the relationship hierarchy where representantes can have parent-child relationships through the representante_id_pai field, allowing for organizational structures within representation. Include practical examples of queries that traverse these relationships, such as finding all clients involved in a specific process, identifying all processes associated with a particular opposing party, or retrieving the complete party structure for a given case.

wiki_catalogs.name: Acervo Geral Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Acervo Geral tribunal integration endpoints in the Sinesys system. Document the HTTP GET method, URL pattern /api/captura/trt/acervo-geral with tribunalId parameter, and optional filters like page, limit, and search terms. Detail the request authentication using Supabase session and tribunal credentials from the credenciais table. Document the response schema including process metadata, class, distribution date, and status. Explain the implementation flow from route handler to acervo-geral.service.ts, including trt-auth.service.ts authentication and Puppeteer-based data extraction. Provide examples of frontend calls from the capture interface and address common issues like tribunal CAPTCHA challenges, session timeouts, and pagination handling. Include performance considerations for large acervo datasets and error recovery mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Process-Document Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the relationship between documents and legal processes in the Sinesys system. Explain how documentos are linked to processos through the generic foreign key system using 'entidade_tipo' and 'entidade_id' fields. Document the implementation of process-document associations in the database schema, including the constraints and indexes that ensure data integrity. Describe the API endpoints that handle process-document operations, such as creating, retrieving, and deleting document associations. Provide examples of how the frontend components display documents related to a specific legal process, including the data fetching patterns and state management. Explain the user interface for adding documents to processes and viewing process-related documents. Include information about permission checks that ensure users can only access documents for processes they have authorization to view. Detail any performance optimizations for querying documents by process, such as database indexing strategies or caching mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Acervo Geral Capture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Acervo Geral Capture feature. Explain the implementation of the acervo-geral.service.ts that orchestrates the capture process by calling the PJE-TRT API's obter-processos endpoint. Document how the captura-form-base.tsx component collects user input for tribunal selection and authentication credentials, and how this data is validated before initiating the capture. Detail the data transformation process from the PJE-TRT API response to the application's domain model, including handling of multi-instance processes and unification logic. Explain the persistence mechanism in the capturas table as defined in 21_capturas.sql, including the storage of raw API responses and processed data. Address specific challenges like handling large result sets, pagination strategies, and error recovery for partial captures, referencing the test script that validates this functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Scheduled Captures Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Scheduled Captures Management interface of the Sinesys application. Thoroughly explain the UI components including agendamentos-list.tsx for displaying, filtering, and managing scheduled captures with pagination and status indicators, and agendamento-form.tsx for creating and editing capture schedules with form validation and error handling. Document the backend CRUD operations through criar-agendamento.service.ts for creating new schedules and listar-agendamentos.service.ts for retrieving existing schedules. Cover the data model for scheduled captures including frequency patterns, tribunal selection, credential association, and process filters. Explain the integration between frontend and backend, including form submission handling, success/error states, and real-time updates. Address common issues like form validation errors, duplicate schedule creation, and timezone display inconsistencies, with solutions implemented in the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Acervo Table
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the acervo table in the Sinesys legal management system. Detail the entity structure with fields including numero_processo (VARCHAR, primary key), tribunal (ENUM referencing tribunals table), grau (ENUM for first/second degree), classe_judicial (VARCHAR for legal classification), orgao_julgador (VARCHAR), vara (VARCHAR), assunto (TEXT), data_distribuicao (DATE), segredo_justica (BOOLEAN), and responsavel_id (UUID foreign key to usuarios). Document the relationships with other tables such as having multiple audiencias and expedientes. Explain the purpose of each field in the context of legal process tracking. Include information about constraints, indexes (particularly on responsavel_id and tribunal), and triggers that maintain data integrity. Provide sample records illustrating typical process data. Document how this table integrates with the PJE-TRT data capture system and supports dashboard visualizations. Address data lifecycle considerations and performance optimization for large datasets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Acordos Condenações Table
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the acordos_condenacoes table in the Sinesys legal management system. Detail all fields including id (UUID primary key), valor_total (NUMERIC with precision 10,2), data_inicio (DATE), data_fim (DATE), status (ENUM with values 'ativo', 'concluido', 'cancelado'), cliente_id (UUID foreign key to clientes), and created_at (TIMESTAMP). Document the relationship with parcelas table through one-to-many association, and with repasses table for payment tracking. Explain business rules such as validation that data_fim must be after data_inicio, and that valor_total must be positive. Include information about indexes on cliente_id and status fields for query optimization. Describe how this table supports agreement management, payment scheduling, and financial reporting. Provide sample records showing typical agreement data and explain how the data is used in the application's financial workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contratos Table
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the contratos table in the Sinesys legal management system. Detail all fields including contrato_type (ENUM with values like 'PRESTACAO_SERVICOS', 'HONORARIOS_SUCESSO'), valor (NUMERIC with precision 10,2), periodicidade (ENUM with values like 'UNICO', 'MENSAL', 'TRIMESTRAL'), data_inicio (DATE), data_fim (DATE), cliente_id (foreign key to clientes), and created_at/updated_at timestamps. Document the relationship with clientes through cliente_id, and with processos through the contrato_processos junction table. Explain business rules such as validation of date ranges, value constraints, and type-specific requirements. Include information about indexes on cliente_id and data_inicio/data_fim for query optimization. Describe triggers that maintain data consistency and any RLS policies for access control. Provide sample records illustrating different contract types and their configurations. Document how this table supports contract lifecycle management and billing automation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flows
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication flows in the Sinesys data capture system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of authenticating with the PJE-TRT system, including credential management, session handling, and token refresh mechanisms. Document the interfaces for storing and retrieving credentials securely, the domain model for representing authentication states, and usage patterns for handling multi-factor authentication and session expiration. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how authentication is integrated with navigation workflows. Explain relationships with other components such as the credential cache service and browser connection service. Address common issues like credential rejection, session timeouts, and authentication rate limiting, providing solutions such as credential rotation and exponential backoff strategies. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Connection Pooling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the connection pooling mechanism in the Sinesys browser connection management system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of how browser instances are created, reused, and managed in a pool to optimize resource utilization during PJE-TRT data capture. Document the interfaces for acquiring and releasing browser connections, the domain model for representing pooled browser contexts, and usage patterns for handling concurrent data capture requests. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing connection acquisition strategies, pool size configuration, and thread-safe access patterns. Explain relationships with other components such as the scheduler service and credential management. Address common issues like connection exhaustion, race conditions, and memory leaks, providing solutions such as timeout mechanisms, maximum pool size limits, and health checks. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Download Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the download management component of the Sinesys document extraction system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of downloading documents from the PJE-TRT interface, including handling authentication, managing download requests, and processing responses. Document the interfaces for initiating downloads, the domain model for tracking download status and progress, and usage patterns for handling large files and batch operations. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how download requests are constructed, how responses are processed, and how errors are handled. Explain relationships with other components such as the browser automation service and the document persistence layer. Address common issues like network timeouts, incomplete downloads, and rate limiting, providing solutions such as retry mechanisms, download resumption, and progress tracking. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Classification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the error classification system in Sinesys data capture. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of the error categorization model defined in types.ts, including how different error types (e.g., AUTHENTICATION_FAILED, NETWORK_TIMEOUT, PARSING_ERROR, RATE_LIMITED) are structured and classified. Document the interfaces used for error representation, the domain model for error severity levels (CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW), and usage patterns for mapping HTTP status codes and response patterns to specific error categories. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how specific error responses from PJE-TRT APIs are classified, such as 401/403 responses mapped to authentication failures or 429 responses mapped to rate limiting. Document the type definitions for ErrorClassification and RecoveryStrategy, parameters for error matching patterns, and return values that determine appropriate recovery actions. Explain relationships with other components such as the capture log system and the recovery execution service. Address common issues like ambiguous error responses that could match multiple categories, providing solutions such as priority-based matching and context-aware classification. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Automated Retry Strategies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the automated retry strategies in Sinesys data capture. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of the retry mechanisms in captura-recovery.service, including the retry scheduling algorithm, backoff strategies, and failure detection logic. Document the interfaces for configuring retry policies, the domain model for tracking retry attempts and their outcomes, and usage patterns for different types of failures such as network timeouts, rate limiting, and temporary service unavailability. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how retry workflows are implemented, such as the exponential backoff implementation and circuit breaker patterns. Document configuration options for retry parameters like maximum attempts, initial delay, and multiplier factors, as well as return values indicating retry status and final outcomes. Explain relationships with other components such as the capture scheduler and error monitoring system. Address common issues like thundering herd problems, resource exhaustion during retries, and cascading failures, providing solutions such as jitter in backoff intervals, retry budgets, and bulkhead patterns. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Synchronization Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the synchronization mechanism in Sinesys real-time collaboration. Thoroughly explain how the Supabase Yjs provider establishes WebSocket connections for real-time document synchronization, including connection lifecycle management, authentication, and reconnection strategies. Document the implementation of the collaborative plate editor and how it integrates with the Yjs CRDT system to propagate changes across clients. Describe the data flow from user input to remote synchronization, including debouncing, change detection, and network transmission. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how document updates are serialized, transmitted, and applied across clients. Address performance considerations such as bandwidth optimization, message batching, and latency reduction. Explain how the system handles connection interruptions and ensures data consistency during network fluctuations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Log Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the log structure in Sinesys data capture system. Thoroughly explain the implementation details of the log entry schema, including fields such as timestamp, correlation ID, capture session ID, error type, and structured metadata. Document the interfaces for creating and retrieving log entries, the domain model for log data including hierarchical context preservation, and usage patterns for consistent log formatting across different capture scenarios. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how log entries are structured for different error types such as authentication failures, network timeouts, and parsing errors. Document configuration options for log formatting, parameters for custom field inclusion, and return values from log creation operations. Explain relationships with other components such as the recovery analysis system that uses log data to identify failure patterns and the monitoring dashboard that visualizes log trends. Address common issues like inconsistent log formats, missing contextual information, and performance overhead from excessive logging, providing solutions such as standardized log templates, automatic context injection, and asynchronous logging.

wiki_catalogs.name: Editor Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the document editor architecture in Sinesys. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the Plate editor framework built on Slate.js, including its modular plugin architecture and composable editor kits. Document how the editor is structured as a React component with layered functionality through base kits and extended kits. Explain the configuration and composition of editor features such as basic nodes, marks, blocks, and toolbars. Describe the integration between the PlateEditor component and the application's document management system, including initialization, content loading, and state synchronization. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how editor kits are imported and configured. Address architectural decisions behind using Plate over other rich text editors and how it supports the application's collaborative editing requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Fixed Toolbar
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the fixed toolbar component in Sinesys document editor. Explain how the FixedToolbarKit provides persistent access to formatting tools at the top of the editor interface. Document the implementation of formatting controls for bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, code, and highlight. Describe the heading level selectors (H1, H2, H3) and their integration with the document structure. Detail the list formatting options (ordered, unordered, and todo lists) and blockquote functionality. Include examples showing how the toolbar maintains its position during scrolling and how it's integrated with the Plate editor framework. Explain the responsive behavior of the toolbar on different screen sizes and how toolbar items may collapse into overflow menus on smaller devices. Address common issues such as z-index conflicts with other UI elements and performance considerations when rendering the toolbar during frequent editor state changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI-powered features in the Sinesys document editor. Thoroughly explain the implementation of AI-assisted writing capabilities through the AiKit and CopilotKit, including how these extensions integrate with backend AI services to provide content generation, text completion, and smart suggestions. Document the architecture of the AI extension system, showing how AI commands are registered, how context is passed between the editor and AI services, and how responses are rendered in the document. Include concrete examples from the codebase demonstrating AI actions for legal document drafting, process description generation, and hearing summary creation. Explain configuration options for AI features, including system prompts, action definitions, and response handling. Address common issues such as AI response latency, content accuracy verification, and user privacy considerations when sending document content to AI services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Grid System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the dashboard grid system in Sinesys. Explain the implementation of the EnhancedDashboardGrid component, its responsive layout capabilities, and how it manages widget positioning. Document the integration with React DnD for drag-and-drop functionality and the use of CSS grid for layout management. Include examples of grid configuration options, breakpoints, and responsive behavior. Explain how the grid interacts with the dashboard store to persist layout changes and how it handles different screen sizes. Address common issues such as widget overflow, responsive breakpoints, and performance optimization for large numbers of widgets. Provide code examples showing grid initialization and configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Signature Capture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the signature capture components in Sinesys. Explain the implementation of the multi-step capture process including photo capture, geolocation verification, and handwritten signature collection. Describe how the CapturaFotoStep integrates with device camera APIs and handles image preprocessing. Include examples of how these components are used in the signature workflow, their integration with form validation, and security considerations for biometric data handling. Address common issues such as mobile device compatibility, signature quality optimization, and error handling during capture. Provide technical details on data flow from capture to storage and how captured signatures are associated with forms and templates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Editor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the document editor component in Sinesys. Document the architecture of the collaborative editing system, including how operational transforms are handled and how conflicts are resolved. wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed entity relationship documentation for the Sinesys database.
